page.title: 03A FARM AT APPELBY
page.content: The farm is heavily mechanised having a large combined harvester with an 18ft bed, a large four wheel drive tractor of 160h.p., several smaller tractors of 100h.p. or so, a fork lift tractor for moving palletised loads, sugar beet and potato harvesters etc. The farm workers are{skilled craftsmen and the ratio is about one man to 200 acres. Over the years trees have been felled and have fallen down and around 1980 all the{elm trees}caught a fatal disease said to originate in Holand. So to replace these, a number of trees have been planted this year along road sides and hedge sides. The thorn edges are trimmed mechanically after July 1st each year in order to have a growth period also to allow wild birds such as{partridges}to hatch out unmolested.
